qas.question: What did Bell call the best thing he ever made?
Bell thought the photophone was better than what famous invention?
What modern technology takes the next step from the photophone?
In what decade did fiber-optics become widely used?

context: Bell believed the photophone's principles were his life's "greatest achievement", telling a reporter shortly before his death that the photophone was "the greatest invention [I have] ever made, greater than the <a1_0>telephone<a1_0/>". <a0_0>The photophone<a0_0/> was a precursor to the <a2_0>fiber-optic communication<a2_0/> systems which achieved popular worldwide usage in the <a4_0>1980s<a4_0/>. Its master patent was issued in December <a3_0>1880<a3_0/>, many decades before the photophone's principles came into popular use.
